p: Table 6 shows a comparison of IC 50 average values ( μg/mL) calculated from individual IC 50 values for each enzyme families presented previously. As shown in this table, most of the mean values of IC 50 for ethanolic and aqueous extracts on all digestive enzymes used are lower than the lower cytotoxic concentration that caused 50% of cell death (30 μg/mL for ethanolic extract and >100 μg/mL for aqueous extract).
